name: Investment by Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPI) in Debt – Review (RBI/2017-18/199 A.P. (DIR Series) Circular No.31)
summary: This circular revises regulations for FPI investments in debt instruments in India. Key changes include modifying minimum residual maturity requirements for government and corporate bonds, increasing the cap on aggregate FPI investments in government securities to 30%, implementing online monitoring of G-sec and SDL investments through CCIL, establishing concentration limits for different categories of FPIs, and setting single/group investor-wise limits in corporate bonds. The document introduces the concept of 'Exempted Securities' and provides operational flexibility for FPIs and custodians to adapt to these regulations.
questions: What is the maximum percentage of short-term investments allowed for an FPI in any category?
What is the concentration limit for long-term FPIs in each category of debt?
What is the maximum percentage of any issue of a corporate bond that can be invested in by an FPI including related FPIs?
What is the reinvestment time period allowed for FPIs after sale/redemption of securities in G-secs and SDLs?
Which organization is responsible for online monitoring of utilization of FPI investment limits in G-secs and SDLs?
